item.title: Fly tipping household items and waste, 19th July
item.description:
There is continually household furniture and waste flytipped along widnus walk. It is bringing the area down.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kyverdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tress on Samos Road desperately need cutting back. The branches are dangerously low and obstruct the paths as you can’t walk without the branches hitting you in the face., 19th July
item.description:
It’s dangerous that people are hit in face by branches, but the tress also block out the light in the properties now. When the trees shed, and it rains the pavements are very slippery and people have fallen over. We pay high council taxes, please can the trees be sorted!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Samos Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 19th July
item.description:
On this corner, it seems rubbish / bin bags are continually dropped off and end up ripped open and litter, decomposing food, and waste as strewn everywhere
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Blocked gully, 19th July
item.description:
This gully is blocked & has repeatedly been blocked, overflowing during rainy weather. It's on Lauriston Rd near the junction with Penshurst. The council has unblocked it before- there are basement flats near by that are vulnerable to flash flooding.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken tree stake, 19th July
item.description:
